variants.Description in input context: Del 245 mutation (large deletion after amino acid 245)

Material used.Description: Oxygen consumption in intact SH-SY5Y cells was measured using a Clark-type polarographic electrode.

Readout description.Result Description: A statistically significant defect in O2 consumption rate was observed in SH-SY5Y cells expressing L347P PINK1 (37.7% reduction compared to wild type PINK1).
A statistically significant defect in O2 consumption rate was observed in SH-SY5Y cells expressing E417G PINK1 (23.1% reduction compared to wild type PINK1).
Del 245 PINK1 did not cause a respiratory defect in SH-SY5Y cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple biological replicates (n=3 for respiration measurements).

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild type PINK1 was used as a positive control for comparison with mutant PINK1.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-infected SH-SY5Y cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis of differences in oxygen consumption.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oxygen consumption rate comparable to wild type PINK1 control (no significant reduction).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Oxygen consumption rate significantly reduced compared to wild type PINK1 control (e.g., >20% reduction).

Material used.Description: ATP synthesis was measured in digitonin-permeabilized SH-SY5Y cells using a luciferase-based kinetic assay.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing L347P PINK1 showed a statistically significant reduction in mitochondrial ATP synthesis (23% reduction compared to wild type PINK1).
Cells expressing E417G PINK1 showed a statistically significant reduction in mitochondrial ATP synthesis (19.7% reduction compared to wild type PINK1).
Del 245 PINK1 did not show a defect in ATP synthesis.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple biological replicates (n=5-15 for ATP synthesis measurements).

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild type PINK1 was used as a positive control for comparison with mutant PINK1.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-infected SH-SY5Y cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student t-test and ANOVA were used for statistical analysis of differences in ATP synthesis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ATP synthesis rate comparable to wild type PINK1 control (no significant reduction).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: ATP synthesis rate significantly reduced compared to wild type PINK1 control (e.g., >15% reduction).

Material used.Description: Chymotrypsin activity was measured in SH-SY5Y cells infected with adenovirus expressing wild type, L347P, and E417G PINK1.

Readout description.Result Description: SH-SY5Y cells expressing L347P PINK1 showed a statistically significant decrease in proteasome activity (23% reduction compared to wild type PINK1).
SH-SY5Y cells expressing E417G PINK1 showed a statistically significant decrease in proteasome activity (19.4% reduction compared to wild type PINK1).
No specific data provided for Del 245 PINK1 in this assay.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple biological replicates (n=7-8 for proteasome activity measurements).

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild type PINK1 was used as a positive control for comparison with mutant PINK1.

Basic negative control.Description: MG132, a proteasome inhibitor, was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Paired Student t-test was used for statistical analysis of differences in proteasome activity.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Proteasome activity comparable to wild type PINK1 control (no significant reduction).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Proteasome activity significantly reduced compared to wild type PINK1 control (e.g., >15% reduction).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Filter Trap Assay for a-Synuclein Aggregation

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells or stable HeLa cell lines expressing wild type or A53T a-synuclein were transfected with siRNA against PINK1.

Readout description.Result Description: No specific data provided for L347P PINK1 in this assay; general loss of PINK1 function via siRNA led to increased a-synuclein aggregation.
No specific data provided for E417G PINK1 in this assay; general loss of PINK1 function via siRNA led to increased a-synuclein aggregation.
No specific data provided for Del 245 PINK1 in this assay; general loss of PINK1 function via siRNA led to increased a-synuclein aggregation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple biological replicates (n=4 for densitometry analysis).

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Scrambled siRNA (siSCR) was used as a positive control showing no visible aggregates.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control mentioned for this assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis of differences in a-synuclein aggregation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No significant increase in SDS-insoluble a-synuclein aggregates compared to control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in SDS-insoluble a-synuclein aggregates compared to control (p<0.05).
